page.title: 08ACKTON HALL COLLIERY
page.content: Ackton Hall Colliery is situated amongst open fields near Featherstone. The first shafts were sunk in 1877 in order to get men to the coal face more quickly but coal was still brought to the workings at Featherstone. The pit had many different owners before being taken over by the NCB in 1947. In 1966 a major reconstruction programme took place and further major improvement took place in 1976 as the old coal seam was worked out. The colliery has had a good working life but is due for closure in July 1985. During the 1984/85 miners strike 3 underground fires cost the NCB Â£7.million destroying the Barnsley bed seams. Even before the dispute the pit was due for closure as 12000 tonnes of material had to be brought to the surface in order to get 6000 tonnes of coal.
